Entries.default: "I have a grimoire for your library, Nemnok."
"Farewell."
"SHOW ME." Nemnok eases closer and flares its nostrils at your pack.
[Give book.] "The Brawler's grimoire, wrested from the hands of an ancient lich."
[Give book.] "Bipara's grimoire, recovered from a swamp witch's hut."
[Give book.] "Menzzago's grimoire, once held by the fampyr illusionist of Splintered Reef."
"On second thought, back to my questions."

"EXCELLENT. IF AN IGNORANT OUTLANDER CAN DEFEAT DEATH, SO CAN I AND THE REST OF MY KIND." 

Nemnok cradles the grimoire and nods.

"AH. THERE IS MUCH TO BE GLEANED FROM THE SCRIBBLINGS OF A CRONE." 

Nemnok holds the grimoire by its spine and shakes it hard. Dozens of silverfish tumble to the ground.
"EXCELLENT. YOU SERVE ME WELL, CHILD."
"I have another grimoire for you."
"I wanted to know more about you."

"I HAVE BOOKS ENOUGH FOR THE MOMENT. ACCEPT YOUR FINAL REWARD AND GO." 

Nemnok makes a dismissive gesture toward the three chests, its attention wandering elsewhere.
"LEAVE THIS PLACE, ACOLYTE. UNTIL I SUMMON YOU AGAIN."
"YOU RETURN." Nemnok opens a claw and gestures for you to speak freely.
"SPEAK YOUR MIND, ACOLYTE."

"TAKE FROM THE TREASURE PILE, BUT TAKE ONE REWARD ONLY." 

Nemnok holds up a single long talon.
"Thank you, generous Nemnok."
"Two baubles. Got it."
"Just one? Nemnok, be reasonable..."

"ONE REWARD IS PLENTY, CHILD. DO YOU QUESTION ME?" 

Nemnok leans closer, its hot and rancid breath crossing the gap.
[Attack] "I've decided to take all the treasure. Try and stop me."
"Not yet, at least. Farewell."

"JUST REWARDS FOR JUST SERVICE TO YOUR GOD, CHILD." 

Nemnok inclines its horned head.

"DID YOU MISHEAR ME, ACOLYTE? IS DISCIPLINE REQUIRED?" 

Narrowing its eyes, Nemnok eases closer.

"NOW THAT OUR ACCORD IS STRUCK, WE MUST MAKE WHAT WE CAN OF THE ARRANGEMENT." 

One of Nemnok's massive eyes bulges with interest.
"Tell me what you require, Nemnok."

With a brief muttering and the wave of a claw, an inkwell and sheet of parchment materialize out of nowhere. Nemnok dips one long index talon in the ink and begins to write in long, swooping scribbles.

"SIMPLE INSTRUCTIONS FOR SIMPLE MINDS. 

"RETURN WITH THE BOOKS I OUTLINED AND YOU MAY CHOOSE YOUR REWARD FROM THE PILE."

Nemnok gestures over to the chests at the foot of the massive statue. With a snap of its talons the parchment materializes in your hand.
"NOW GO. WASTE NO MORE OF MY TIME."

"How many imps do you think he had to eat to get that big?"

The great imp snorts and glares at Edér with suspicion, but does not seem to have overheard him.
"Happily." Aloth winces, rubbing his ears.
"Ac, I am certain he has many important things to get to."
"My poor ears. Ekera, can we leave now?" Tekēhu wiggles a pinkie in his ear, causing his hair to squirm in response.
"Ain't we got better things to do?"
<ispeech>Sure on this one, are you, cap? Troll-tall or no, imps still be three sheets short of sailing when they ain't fat up on worship.</ispeech>
"THERE IS WORK FOR YOU IF YOU CHOOSE TO TARRY IN MY MOUNTAIN OF POWER."

"MY CHILD, OUR COVENANT IS ONE BOUND IN LOYAL SERVICE.

"ARE YOU PREPARED?"
[Attack] "I'll do nothing for you, fiend."

"YOU WOULD SPURN MY TRUST? THEN DIE!"

Nemnok points down at you and fills the hall with a prolonged shriek of rage.
"That... won't be necessary. Thank you, Nemnok."
"I should go. Farewell."
"Never, Nemnok. I accept what I am owed."
"I WAS ONCE A GOD OF CHAINS AND SERVITUDE, FEAR AND WEAKNESS."

"KNOWLEDGE WAS THE HAMMER THAT CAST ME FREE OF SHACKLES, AND NOW I AM THE MASTER!" 

The chanting of acolytes redoubles, echoing down the hall.
"You sound a bit like Skaen, but... you're not Skaen."
"It's just that I haven't seen you among the other gods."
"No further questions, Nemnok."
"I AM NEMNOK. GOD OF THE MOUNTAIN. NO OTHER NAME IS WARRANTED, CHILD."
"NO FURTHER QUESTIONS. EVEN MY PATIENCE HAS LIMITS."
"I'm still hunting grimoires for you."
"EXCELLENT, CHILD. FAITHFUL SERVICE WILL BE REWARDED IN THIS LIFE AND THE NEXT." Nemnok crosses its arms over its chest. Many of the surrounding acolytes do the same.
"AND WHY WOULD I LIMIT MYSELF BY SUBMITTING TO A COUNCIL OF SMALL MINDS, CHILD?" Nemnok waves the matter aside.
"YOU ARE WISE NOT TO PRESS THE MATTER, CHILD. THE FAITH OF MY ACOLYTES IS BEYOND PETTY INQUIRY." Nemnok nods with approval.
"DO NOT FAIL ME."
"Nemnok! Nemnok!"
